trans-unit.source: Get File
trans-unit.target: Get File

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation reads or downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation reads or downloads a file from the system, including its metadata and properties.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:
trans-unit.target: Replace the path components shown in the request URI with your own, as follows:

trans-unit.source: Path Component
trans-unit.target: Path Component

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: myaccount
trans-unit.target: myaccount

trans-unit.source: The name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: The name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: myshare
trans-unit.target: myshare

trans-unit.source: The name of your file share.
trans-unit.target: The name of your file share.

trans-unit.source: mydirectorypath
trans-unit.target: mydirectorypath

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The path to the directory.
trans-unit.target: The path to the directory.

trans-unit.source: myfile
trans-unit.target: myfile

trans-unit.source: The name of the file.
trans-unit.target: The name of the file.

trans-unit.source: For details on path naming restrictions, see <link xlink:href="f38d4c69-cb50-4ef3-a8a3-276341689769" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details on path naming restrictions, see <link xlink:href="f38d4c69-cb50-4ef3-a8a3-276341689769" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Naming and Referencing Shares, Directories, Files, and Metadata</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: The following additional parameters may be specified on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>timeout</parameterReference> parameter is expressed in seconds.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="2ea86972-4df0-4b87-97fd-3c88910c15e0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="2ea86972-4df0-4b87-97fd-3c88910c15e0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Setting Timeouts for File Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes required and optional request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) for the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="96cec7bc-63cc-4227-920a-dddd850433c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Schemes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Required for all authenticated requests.
trans-unit.target: Required for all authenticated requests.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link>.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request For more information, see <link xlink:href="cc4fba5c-7015-40bf-a29c-b6f0c684ff3c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Versioning for the Azure Storage Services</link>.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Return file data only from the specified byte range.
trans-unit.target: Return file data only from the specified byte range.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Return file data only from the specified byte range.
trans-unit.target: Return file data only from the specified byte range.

trans-unit.source: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: If both <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference> are specified, the service uses the value of <parameterReference>x-ms-range</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: If neither are specified, the entire file contents are returned.
trans-unit.target: If neither are specified, the entire file contents are returned.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="824245eb-02aa-4717-980c-e1f6c7d39ba4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for File Service Operations</link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="824245eb-02aa-4717-980c-e1f6c7d39ba4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Specifying the Range Header for File Service Operations</link> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: When this header is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and specified together with the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, the service returns the MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.
trans-unit.target: When this header is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> and specified together with the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, the service returns the MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range is less than or equal to 4 MB in size.

trans-unit.source: If this header is specified without the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If this header is specified without the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> header, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: If this header is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> when the range exceeds 4 MB in size, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If this header is set to <codeInline>true</codeInline> when the range exceeds 4 MB in size, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and the response body, which contains the contents of the file.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and the response body, which contains the contents of the file.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Returns the date and time the file was last modified.
trans-unit.target: Returns the date and time the file was last modified.

trans-unit.source: The date format follows RFC 1123.
trans-unit.target: The date format follows RFC 1123.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="d4f67d84-a51c-4ff7-8bd0-0ae206c9e3c9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Representation of Date/Time Values in Headers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Any operation that modifies the file or its properties updates the last modified time.
trans-unit.target: Any operation that modifies the file or its properties updates the last modified time.

trans-unit.source: A set of name-value pairs associated with this file as user-defined metadata.
trans-unit.target: A set of name-value pairs associated with this file as user-defined metadata.

trans-unit.source: The number of bytes present in the response body.
trans-unit.target: The number of bytes present in the response body.

trans-unit.source: The content type specified for the file.
trans-unit.target: The content type specified for the file.

trans-unit.source: The default content type is <languageKeyword>application/octet-stream</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The default content type is <languageKeyword>application/octet-stream</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the range of bytes returned if the client requested a subset of the file by setting the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the range of bytes returned if the client requested a subset of the file by setting the <parameterReference>Range</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: The ETag contains a value that you can use to perform operations conditionally, in quotes.
trans-unit.target: The ETag contains a value that you can use to perform operations conditionally, in quotes.

trans-unit.source: If the file has an MD5 hash and the request is to read the full file, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.
trans-unit.target: If the file has an MD5 hash and the request is to read the full file, this response header is returned so that the client can check for message content integrity.

trans-unit.source: If the request is to read a specified range and the <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is set to true, then the request returns an MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range size is less than or equal to 4 MB.
trans-unit.target: If the request is to read a specified range and the <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is set to true, then the request returns an MD5 hash for the range, as long as the range size is less than or equal to 4 MB.

trans-unit.source: If neither of these sets of conditions is true, then no value is returned for the <parameterReference>Content-MD5</parameterReference> header.
trans-unit.target: If neither of these sets of conditions is true, then no value is returned for the <parameterReference>Content-MD5</parameterReference> header.

trans-unit.source: If <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is specified without the Range header, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is specified without the Range header, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: If <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is set to true when the range exceeds 4 MB in size, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).
trans-unit.target: If <parameterReference>x-ms-range-get-content-md5</parameterReference> is set to true when the range exceeds 4 MB in size, the service returns status code 400 (Bad Request).

trans-unit.source: This header returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>Content-Encoding</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: This header returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>Content-Encoding</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: This header returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>Content-Language</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: This header returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>Content-Language</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned if it was previously specified for the file.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned if it was previously specified for the file.

trans-unit.source: Returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>x-ms-content-disposition</parameterReference> header and specifies how to process the response.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value that was specified for the <parameterReference>x-ms-content-disposition</parameterReference> header and specifies how to process the response.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>Content-Disposition</parameterReference> response header field conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>Content-Disposition</parameterReference> response header field conveys additional information about how to process the response payload, and also can be used to attach additional metadata.

trans-unit.source: For example, if set to <codeInline>attachment</codeInline>, <parameterReference>Content-Disposition</parameterReference> indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a <ui>Save As</ui> dialog.
trans-unit.target: For example, if set to <codeInline>attachment</codeInline>, <parameterReference>Content-Disposition</parameterReference> indicates that the user-agent should not display the response, but instead show a <ui>Save As</ui> dialog.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the File service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the service supports requests for partial file content.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the service supports requests for partial file content.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The response body contains the content of the file.
trans-unit.target: The response body contains the content of the file.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: Only the account owner may call this operation.
trans-unit.target: Only the account owner may call this operation.

trans-unit.source: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> over a range that does not yet have content or that has been cleared returns zeros for those bytes.
trans-unit.target: Calling <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> over a range that does not yet have content or that has been cleared returns zeros for those bytes.

trans-unit.source: If you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with no range specified, the service returns the range of bytes up to the value specified for the <parameterReference>x-ms-content-length</parameterReference> header.
trans-unit.target: If you call <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> with no range specified, the service returns the range of bytes up to the value specified for the <parameterReference>x-ms-content-length</parameterReference> header.

trans-unit.source: For any ranges lacking content, the service returns zeros for those bytes.
trans-unit.target: For any ranges lacking content, the service returns zeros for those bytes.

trans-unit.source: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is allowed 2 minutes per MB to complete.
trans-unit.target: A <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Get File</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation is allowed 2 minutes per MB to complete.

trans-unit.source: Operations that take longer than 2 minutes per MB on average will time out.
trans-unit.target: Operations that take longer than 2 minutes per MB on average will time out.
